There is a line of $m$ groups of $n$ people. Each group represents people from the same city who arrived on a bus. The people within each group are in the order they arrived on the bus.  

You need to form teams of $k$ people from the same city who are standing next to each other in the line. Once a team is formed, they leave the line. This continues until there are no more groups of $k$ consecutive people from the same city.

Given $n$, $k$, and $m$, find the number of people remaining in the line.

You have a line of people representing participants from different cities.  People from the same city are grouped together. Teams of a fixed size can be formed from consecutive people of the same city.  Teams leave the line once formed.  Find the number of people remaining in the line after all possible teams have been formed.
